title: Behavior of a function based on its derivatives

content.question: Let g be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>100</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>20</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>π</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mn>10</mn> <mi>cos</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>π</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mn>6</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@550B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EFA@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is decreasing most rapidly when t =

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
